{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3605338,"name":"Zakk Jackson","username":"Zakk_J","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zakk_j/{size}/268534_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T00:42:28.540Z","cooked":"

I am looking for ways to make hot-swappable arms for an FTC mascot bot.

What I mean by this is I want to have different arms for different tasks so that the arms would have different things on them, such as different amounts of motors, servos, and sensors.

I would want the arm to be able to rotate at the attachment point (or what would be the shoulder of the mascot bot).

EDIT: If this is not possible it’s fine I just wanted to know if anyone else has tried/done this.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T00:46:58.262Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":402,"readers_count":401,"score":125.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":500697,"topic_slug":"hot-swappable-arms-ftc","display_username":"Zakk Jackson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73488,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1912 Volunteer Coordinator of Engineering"},"post_url":"/t/hot-swappable-arms-ftc/500697/1","custom_user_title":"1912 Volunteer Coordinator of Engineering","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3605507,"name":"","username":"rwwin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/6de8d8/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T01:41:05.564Z","cooked":"

If you’re looking for true “hot swappable” (i.e. with a teleop program initiated) it would be difficult (not to mention dangerous) but doable. We’ve had swappable mechanisms in the past but the swap was always made between matches with the robot powered down. Can you provide more information on what you’re trying to do?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T01:41:05.564Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":350,"readers_count":349,"score":75.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500697,"topic_slug":"hot-swappable-arms-ftc","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57083,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/hot-swappable-arms-ftc/500697/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3605511,"name":"Zakk Jackson","username":"Zakk_J","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zakk_j/{size}/268534_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T01:45:11.481Z","cooked":"

So it would be like your saying, in that the robot would be powered down.

What I want to do is have the main mascot body and then the arms, and I want to be able to change the arms out for different things without having to take the main body off.

I would then just run a different teleop program.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T01:45:11.481Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":308,"readers_count":307,"score":66.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500697,"topic_slug":"hot-swappable-arms-ftc","display_username":"Zakk Jackson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57083,"username":"rwwin","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/6de8d8/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73488,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1912 Volunteer Coordinator of Engineering"},"post_url":"/t/hot-swappable-arms-ftc/500697/3","custom_user_title":"1912 Volunteer Coordinator of Engineering","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3605516,"name":"","username":"rwwin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/6de8d8/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T01:55:43.819Z","cooked":"

That just comes down to configuration then. If you an extra motor port available, run a second motor wire out to where you’re going to make the swap and then you just need to make sure the programmers/drivers/pit crew have a written checklist of which programs need which motors in which ports. If you’re maxing out all your motor ports with both load outs then it’s a little trickier to keep track but still doable.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T01:55:43.819Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":238,"readers_count":237,"score":52.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500697,"topic_slug":"hot-swappable-arms-ftc","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":73488,"username":"Zakk_J","name":"Zakk Jackson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zakk_j/{size}/268534_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57083,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/hot-swappable-arms-ftc/500697/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3605521,"name":"Zakk Jackson","username":"Zakk_J","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zakk_j/{size}/268534_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T02:02:43.360Z","cooked":"

Okay, so what your saying is I would just need to run wire extensions to the attachment point and just have the extensions labeled?

Also, do you know if it’s possible to have more than one expansion hub. This is not made to compete so I don’t care about if it’s legal or not I need to know if it’s possible.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T02:02:43.360Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":195,"readers_count":194,"score":39.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500697,"topic_slug":"hot-swappable-arms-ftc","display_username":"Zakk Jackson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57083,"username":"rwwin","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/6de8d8/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73488,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1912 Volunteer Coordinator of Engineering"},"post_url":"/t/hot-swappable-arms-ftc/500697/5","custom_user_title":"1912 Volunteer Coordinator of Engineering","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3605531,"name":"","username":"rwwin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/6de8d8/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T02:17:30.702Z","cooked":"

You’d only run extra motor wires if you have free ports. If you’ve already maxed out ports then you’re plugging into the same wires when you swap (assuming the swapped mechanism would plug in at the same location. It’s just easier if say if the first load out is always on port 1 and the second load out is always on port 2. How complex the mechanisms your swapping out are will determine how hard it will be.

I don’t know if you can add more than one expansion hub.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T02:17:30.702Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":158,"readers_count":157,"score":36.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500697,"topic_slug":"hot-swappable-arms-ftc","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57083,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/hot-swappable-arms-ftc/500697/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3605533,"name":"Zakk Jackson","username":"Zakk_J","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zakk_j/{size}/268534_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T02:19:19.720Z","cooked":"

Okay, thank you for all of your help!!

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T02:19:19.720Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":27.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":500697,"topic_slug":"hot-swappable-arms-ftc","display_username":"Zakk Jackson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57083,"username":"rwwin","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/6de8d8/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73488,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1912 Volunteer Coordinator of Engineering"},"post_url":"/t/hot-swappable-arms-ftc/500697/7","custom_user_title":"1912 Volunteer Coordinator of Engineering","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3605668,"name":"Sam","username":"Sam948","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T02:47:44.297Z","cooked":"

You can I believe add more than one expansion hub. Legally for competition, I think it’s two, although that was a while ago so don’t quote on me it. For your purposes, that doesn’t terribly matter.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T02:47:44.297Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":44.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500697,"topic_slug":"hot-swappable-arms-ftc","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63767,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8847A | PV"},"post_url":"/t/hot-swappable-arms-ftc/500697/8","custom_user_title":"8847A | PV","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3606158,"name":"","username":"rwwin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/6de8d8/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T15:31:12.411Z","cooked":"

From a competition standpoint your limited to one control hub and one expansion hub (or one android phone & one expansion hub).

For a demonstration robot outside the rules I don’t know if you could configure a second hub or not. I’m not sure how practical it would be. The eight motors on two hubs already puts a heavy load on the battery. Running 9+ motors would drain them even faster.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T15:31:12.411Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":18.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":500697,"topic_slug":"hot-swappable-arms-ftc","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63767,"username":"Sam948","name":"Sam","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57083,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/hot-swappable-arms-ftc/500697/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3606169,"name":"Zakk Jackson","username":"Zakk_J","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zakk_j/{size}/268534_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T15:39:43.810Z","cooked":"

Well for me things like that aren’t a huge issue because of the application. I just did the math and at all times there will be at least 7 motor ports in use. So if I wanted to use motors on the arms I would need additional ports.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-04-28T15:39:43.810Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":59,"readers_count":58,"score":21.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":500697,"topic_slug":"hot-swappable-arms-ftc","display_username":"Zakk Jackson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57083,"username":"rwwin","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/6de8d8/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73488,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1912 Volunteer Coordinator of Engineering"},"post_url":"/t/hot-swappable-arms-ftc/500697/10","custom_user_title":"1912 Volunteer Coordinator of Engineering","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3606206,"name":"","username":"rwwin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/6de8d8/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-28T16:05:54.607Z","cooked":"

OK. I will ping my programmer to see if he knows how to configure a second expansion hub. On the other hand it might be simpler to keep to just the two hubs and then use separate programs with separate config files. That will require more focus to make sure everything is synced between the coders and builders and drivers.

An alternative to additional expansion hubs, if you aren’t using all of the servo ports and you don’t need encoder feedback from all of the motors, is to use SparkMini motor controllers.
